subject: Science
title: Dead Zones
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dead Zones.

hook.text: There are over 400 dead zones in the ocean where almost nothing can survive.

buildup.text: Farm fertilizers wash into rivers, then into the sea, feeding algae blooms.

discovery.text: When the algae die, bacteria decompose them â€” consuming all the dissolved oxygen.

twist.text: Fish, shrimp, and crabs either flee or suffocate. Entire ecosystems collapse.

climax.text: The Gulf of Mexico's dead zone is the size of New Jersey â€” and it forms every summer.

punchline.text: We fertilize our fields. The runoff kills the ocean. Downstream pays the price.

quiz.question: What primarily causes ocean dead zones?
options: Fertilizer runoff feeding algae that consume oxygen
